bibl.title: Letter from Donald C. Brace to John F. Lehmann, 11 July 1932

body.div:
COPY.
New York 11 July 1932
John F. LehmannEsq.Esquire The Hogarth Press 52 Tavistock Square London W.C.l.
Dear Mr.Mister Lehmann:
I have your letter of June 29th inquiring about
our willingness to permit limited importation for collectors
of first editions of Mrs.Missus Woolf's THE COMMON READER II.
Our attitude will be the same as it was in the case of THE
WAVES - that is, we are quite willing to have you give the
exporter not more than 300 copies about ten days before
publication for the purpose of supplying the American market.
I hope your inquiry means that the book is under
way. I should be glad to know when we may expect the
corrected proofs for setting up the American edition.
Yours sincerely,
Donald C. Brace. Harcourt, Brace and Company, Inc.incorporated, Publishers 383 Madison Avenue New York
